poem:
### The Tides of Labor

In silent halls of thought,  
where capital and labor dance,  
Theo penned the splits of hearts—  
divided hands and heavy minds.  
Words etched in time, stark as truth,  
while factories hum the tune of toil—  
here lies a voice, stilled,  
yet echoing amongst the pages,  
like whispers of the worker's song.
